#mensskincare #guybeauty #explore #skincare #ikkaibeauty

How I use exfoliating peel 🍃

🌵Step 1:- wash the face with a face wash to make sure that the skin is completely clean 

🌵Step 2:- Exfoliating peel, Tbh my skin didn't need that strong peel. I specifically wanted to concentrate on my t-zone for blackheads & bumps. A little tingle is normal but if it can't tolerable then wash it off asap. After 5-7 min later wash it off with cold water 

🌵Step 3:-  Apply soothing gel to soothe the area. 

🌵Step 4:-  Use a basic normal Moisturizer to moisturize the skin

Extra tip:- never skip applying your sunscreen otherwise the result u will see the next day 😅 and also skip your all exfoliation products for at least the next 7 days

Tell me, what is your experience with exfoliating peel ????

Love and light, Arghya 💜

UPDATED WINTER SKINCARE ROUTINE🥶 

My skin type becomes more normal to dry in the wintertime. Especially my nose area it becomes super dry & flaky. So I had to change my skincare routine and also I have to keep in mind that using too many products can clog my pores. 

🍂Face wash:- I prefer to use a gentle cleanser so that it doesn't dry out my skin And micellar water if I step out that day 

🍂Toner:- This is my most fav part. Winter is the best time for me to use hydrating toner.

🍂Serum:- Been trying this @unsweetened.beauty royal flash face hydrating boost. Perfect serum for winter it has 5% niacinamide also hyaluronic acid. So it  hydrates the skin as well.

🍂Moisturizer:-  take some emollient base moisturizer and warm it up between fingers. Then press this gently on the skin. In this, my way skin feels more moisturizing and lastly, I put some extra on my nose area 

🍂Spot treatment/exfoliation:- I reduce the use of chemical exfoliation all over my face. Instead, I use it only on my affected area where I get more acne. 

🍂Lip balm:- Good old Boroline is the best treatment for lips. 

And lastly in the morning Sunscreen must 🌞 

Do tell me what is your routine becomes this winter ?? ❄️ 

Love and light, Arghya💜

//LIP CARE ROUTINE 💋// 

Winter is around the corner❄, it means dry, cracked lips So it will be better if you start taking care of your lips from now. 

MORNING 🌞:- 

🍂Hyaluronic acid:- Apply hyaluronic acid or any sort of gel moisturizer with hyaluronic acid /some hydrating ingredients. It will help to hydrate and plump the lip. (always patch test, if the product tingles then discontinued) 

▪️Product used:-  @vyanaturals hyaluronic acid serum 

🍂Spf lip balm:- Then apply lip balm with SPF 15 at least. It will protect the lip from the sun. 

▪️Product used:-  @niveamenindia  lip balm
NIGHT 🌙:- 

🍂Lip oil:- For lip oil u don't need to buy any 
Specific lip oil. You can use any facial oil or carrier oil for that. 

▪️Product used:-  @thedermacoindia squalene oil 

🍂Thick, moisturizing lip balm:- it's gonna heal&repair your chapped, dry lips overnight. 

▪️Product used:- Boroline 

WEEKLY 💆‍♂️:- 

🍂Once in a week gentle exfoliation. It will help to smooth & soft your lips 

▪️Used:- Sugar crushed + honey 🍯 

Tell me which is your favourite steps in lip care routine😊?? 

Love and light, Arghya 💜

#backtobasics 

4 different ways to use your 4 different type of face wash 🌊

Or how I destroyed my skin barrier after using 4 face wash together 😆

🌵1. Normal/basic face wash:- Most face wash comes into this category. This kind of face wash contains a few surfactants and some skin-loving ingredients. 

Use:- the way everyone uses their face wash 

🌵2. 60-sec face wash:- For this, you don't need any different face wash but you have to keep in mind that face wash should have to be gentle. Which doesn't irritate or dry up your skin.

Use:- Wash your face for 60 sec. This washing technique is helpful for normal to oily skin. While washing your face focus on your problematic areas like the nose, forehead where get the tiniest bumps or blackheads.  

🌵3. Chemical Exfoliating face wash:- Face wash which contains BHA, AHA or PHA. Along with washing your face it's also gonna chemically exfoliate your skin. 

Use:- just use like your normal face wash then instead of washing put this on your face for 1-2 min so that the exfoliation ingredients can work better. 

🌵4. Scruby/physical exfoliating face wash:- Though its scrubby particle isn't that harsh like physics exfoliation still I'm not a big fan of it. 

Use:- Take a little amount of this face wash and gently msg your face for 30 sec. Avoid eye or lip area, acne-prone & sensitive skin should stay away from this kind of face wash. Don't use this type of face wash every day.

Tell me which kind of face wash you prefer?

Lova and light, Arghya💜

I recently discovered this brand @meauskin , and its cool packaging instantly caught my eye.

When I received the face wash, I was super excited to try it out.

This is the Dilute_Me Cleansing Gel with hyaluronic acid and triple ceramide. It has a gel-like texture that lathers beautifully and cleanses the skin perfectly.

It’s a deep-cleansing face wash, ideal for nighttime use. It leaves the skin feeling squeaky clean and soft. The product has a mild to medium refreshing fragrance, which is quite pleasant. However, if you’re sensitive to fragrances or prefer fragrance-free products, you might want to skip this one.

Overall, it’s a simple, no-nonsense cleanser that’s perfect for everyday use.

Love and light, Arghya 💜

It’s the @juicy_chemistry Moisturizing Mineral Sunscreen with SPF 40 and PA++++. It’s a 100% certified mineral sunscreen, and the best part? It doesn’t leave any white cast like most other mineral sunscreens. It blends smoothly into the skin and doesn’t feel heavy or greasy at all.

If you have sensitive or easily irritated skin, this is one of the best sunscreens you can pick. Personally, I have oily, acne-prone skin—and I swear, this is the one I always reach for whenever my skin breaks out or feels irritated.

Shop now from @juicy_chemistry

Skincare Routine for Sensitive, Irritated Skin🫧

My skin barrier often gets really compromised and irritated due to several reasons like over-exfoliation, using harsh products, and more. So, I’m always on the lookout for something soothing, calming, and protective for my skin barrier🍃

When I received these products from @nourrir.nourishedlife , I knew I could make the most out of them 😁

Starting with the cleanser — back during the pandemic, I was first introduced to this one. Since then, it has remained one of my OG cleansers. It’s the Cleanse Me cleanser, packed with soothing ingredients like allantoin and colloidal oatmeal. The creamy texture feels extremely gentle on the skin and never drying. It’s the perfect morning cleanser for all skin types.

Next is their Atop Exm Cream. It has a thick, balmy texture that not only deeply moisturizes but also helps heal a damaged skin barrier. Enriched with Dead Sea mud, it leaves the skin feeling hydrated, soothed, and refreshed.

If you have sensitive skin that easily gets irritated, these products could be absolute game-changers for you! 🙌

Love and light, Arghya 💜

#collab #skincare #guybeauty #menskincare #nourrir #sensitiveskincare #sensitiveskin

A Product Review by @mirkleeforskin creme cleaser 🫧

When the brand reached out to me even before their launch, I was super excited after hearing the whole ideology behind it and immediately said yes! When the brand finally launched, they asked me to pick any product I was interested in trying—and I chose this cream cleanser because it seemed like a great pick.

I started using the product from day one (because I have zero patience). At first, I thought it would be a non-foaming cream cleanser that wouldn’t lather on the skin. But after using it, my opinion completely changed! It’s creamy, but it actually creates a nice lather. It feels like your skin is being gently cleansed without stripping it—and to me, that’s the perfect definition of a good cleanser 🙌

It contains panthenol, niacinamide, and hyaluronic acid, so it’s super gentle and still feels hydrating on the skin. I love how my face feels after washing it. For a long time, the Simple Cleanser has been my go-to, but this one might just beat it. It also has a mild, refreshing fragrance—which I absolutely love ❤️

I’m so glad I stuck with this one. I’ve been loving it since day one.
It’s a solid 9/10 🫧

Love and light, Arghya 💜

#menskincare #cleanser #guybeauty #skincare101

When I first received the @round.lab 1025 Dokdo Toner, I honestly thought, "Oh, just another watery toner that probably won't do much except a little hydration." But wow, I was so wrong about this product.
At first, I wasn’t very mindful while using it, but the more I incorporated it into my routine, the more I noticed it does so much more than just hydrate my skin.
Even though it’s watery in texture, it leaves no stickiness behind — it absorbs super quickly, feels incredibly lightweight, and gives an instant boost of hydration. I can actually feel my skin plumping up a little after using it. Plus, it’s really calming; whenever my skin feels a bit irritated or red, I apply this toner, and it works like magic.

And lastly, it creates the perfect base for layering other products — everything absorbs so much better after using this

Available at @maccaron_beauty 

Love and light, Arghya 💜

I've always loved using micellar water for double cleansing, but I gradually lost interest in following up with a cotton pad. The main reason is that it's time-consuming, and I feel like I don't need the extra step—especially since I double cleanse just to remove sunscreen and ensure my skin is deeply clean. So, I switched to using a cleansing oil instead 🙌

After a long time, I realized I could use my micellar water as a foaming cleanser by simply putting it in a foaming cleanser bottle. It creates a foam that works just like a regular foaming cleanser. It's something really basic, but I thought some of you might find this helpful—so yeaah!😮‍💨

It's honestly been a game-changer for me and how I use the product.

Love and light, Arghya 💜

#menskincare #guybeauty #discoverunder5k #micellarwater #bioderma

Sunscreen Review: Relief Sun - Rice + Probiotics from @beautyofjoseon_official

Happy to say this is the second tube I’m using—not just because I finished the first one, but also because it’s my mom’s favorite sunscreen so she took it  from me 🫠

This sunscreen has a creamy, serum-like texture that glides onto the skin the moment you start blending. It leaves no white cast and doesn’t pill at all. I have oily skin, so it’s moisturizing enough for me to skip a separate moisturizer before using this. It gives a beautiful dewy glow—but in a good way—without making me look oily or enhancing skin texture. The subtle glow looks really healthy on my skin. Although, in summer, I sometimes use a bit of powder on my T-zone to prevent it from getting too oily after a while ☀️

Considering my skin type (oily + acne-prone) and the weather I’m in, I always look for sunscreens that are lightweight, easy to blend, and have >= SPF 50 . And this one checks all the boxes!

For those with normal to oily skin, you can skip moisturizer in your morning routine because this sunscreen does the job well, thanks to the rice and probiotics in it. And for dry skin—like my mom’s—using a light moisturizer underneath works perfectly. Sometimes, she even skips moisturizer, saying this sunscreen does both jobs!

Personally, I’d rate this sunscreen 4.5/5 (only because it’s not water-resistant 💔).

You can get this sunscreen currently at @maccaron_beauty

Love and light, Arghya 💜
